fields.label: Instructions
fields.description:
The information you provide here will allow the Curriculum Committee to evaluate your proposed course.

If you need computer assistance in completing or submitting your proposal, please contact Fred Chanania (fchanania@gmail.com, 703-975-3925), or Judy Elstein (elsteinjudith@gmail.com, ‭617-945-1865‬). For content help, please contact any member of the Curriculum Committee.

PLEASE DO NOT submit a proposal more than once. If your proposal isn't complete, you may save it as a draft, finish it later, and then submit it. Contact the Curriculum Committee if you need to make changes to a submitted proposal. Thank you!

fields.label: Course Title
fields.description: This is the way the course will be listed in the catalog.

fields.label: Sponsor
fields.description: Specify who will be the sponsor of this course.

fields.label: Slot
fields.description: Assign time slot.

fields.label: Course Duration
fields.description: Please select the duration for the course you will offer.

fields.label: Scheduling
fields.description: Check the box below if you would be willing to offer this course in the semester following the upcoming semester.

fields.label: Catalog Category
fields.description: Please choose the best category for your course.

fields.label: Course Description (for catalog)
fields.description: Your catalog description must be one paragraph. Please limit it to 150 words. State the content, theme, and goals of the course. Include the class format (lecture, discussion, film, etc.), prerequisites if appropriate, and what is expected of participants. (Please don't include web links, class size, outside preparation, or contact information here.)

fields.label: Workload
fields.description: Please estimate the average number of hours per week of outside preparation required of study group members.
fields.placeholder: Enter a whole number of hours

fields.label: SGL phone
fields.errorMessage: Please enter a valid phone number.

fields.label: Co-leader
fields.description: Check the box below if there will be a second Study Group Leader

fields.label: 2nd SGL phone
fields.errorMessage: Please enter a valid phone number.

fields.label: Readings
fields.description: List required books, optional reading, and other readings and preparation materials below. In general, the total cost of books and materials should not exceed $40-$50. Note that we do not list prices or ISBN numbers. Please do not include them.

fields.label: Books (for catalog)
fields.description: Please list each title separately. To add additional books to the list, click the + in the small circle to the right.

fields.label: Readings string
fields.description: This field is set automatically - do not modify manually.

fields.label: Other required materials (for the catalog)
fields.description: Other than books, what materials will be used by study group members? For example, list movies, online materials, and handouts. Please limit your description to about 50 words. No web link here, please.

fields.label: Other preparation (not for the catalog)
fields.description: Please describe other readings and outside preparation, such as handouts, videos, and online materials you plan to use, to help the Committee understand your course. Include optional reading here.

fields.label: Biographical Statements (for catalog)
fields.description:
Please start with the full name and refer to the SGL in the third person. Include background related to the subject of your course.

Please DO NOT include your email or telephone number here. They are not included in the catalog.

Please limit to 25-40 words in one paragraph per SGL.

fields.label: Schedule
fields.description: What days and times can you offer your course? If you cannot provide three choices, please explain below. Additional flexibility is also much appreciated.

fields.label: Additional Schedule Information
fields.description: Do you have further schedule availability?

fields.label: Time preference summary
fields.description: Automatic field - do not modify

fields.label: Class Size Limit
fields.description: We have two sizes of classroom: those that seat 12 members, plus the SGL, and those that (variously hold between 18 and 25 people. The smaller classrooms have limited AV capabilities, and are not good for showing movies or for heavy use of slides. Larger classrooms all have podiums and good AV facilities and are required for classes with larger enrollments.

fields.label: Class Size
fields.description: Please choose the largest number of students you'd prefer for your class. Please note that decisions about this limit are subject to various factors. If your course is accepted and schedule, its cap will be codmmunicated with your notification.

fields.label: Small Room
fields.description: Please explain how your course content and planned approach would lend themselves to one of the small rooms. The smaller classrooms (G20, 118, and 307) hold 12 or 13 students and one Study Group Leader. Study groups with co-leaders should not select a limit of 12 because the space is too limited in these rooms. The smaller rooms are good for discussion and have projectors, but are poor for movies or extensive use of slides because of the seating arrangements.

fields.label: Colloquium Room

choices.text: I require or strongly prefer the Colloquium Room.
choices.value: I require or strongly prefer the Colloquium Room.

choices.text: I can use the Colloquium Room if that is the only way to accommodate my class size and schedule.
choices.value: I can use the Colloquium Room if that is the only way to accommodate my class size and schedule.

choices.text: I cannot use the Colloquium Room.
choices.value: I cannot use the Colloquium Room.

fields.description: The Colloquium Room can often be used as a classroom and has good AV facilities. Please indicate how well your seminar would work in the room.

fields.label: Scheduling or Room Special Requests
fields.description: Please indicate if you have strong preferences or constraints for rooms or scheduling not expressed above.

fields.label: Further Information for the Curriculum Committee
fields.description: What else should the Committee know about your proposal? You might want to clarify parts of your proposal or indicate how you are planning for the course, what mix of presentation and discussion you anticipate, what you wish participants to get from the course, or what assistance might be helpful to you. These comments will not appear in the catalog.

fields.label: Thank you for preparing your course proposal. You must press the Submit button to send your proposal.
fields.description: You will receive an email confirmation within a few days. DO NOT resubmit this proposal. Please contact the Curriculum Committee if you have changes or questions.

confirmations.name: Default Confirmation
confirmations.message:
Dear HILR Member,

We've received your course proposal and will be in touch soon.

—The HILR Curriculum Committee

confirmations.name: Save and Continue Confirmation
Save and Continue Email Sent Confirmation

notifications.name: Save and Continue Email
notifications.subject: [HILR CC] Link to continue {form_title}
notifications.message:
Dear HILR Member,

Thank you for saving a draft of {form_title}. Please use the unique link below to return to the form from any computer.

{save_link}

Remember that the link will expire after 30 days, so please remember to complete your form submission.

—HILR Curriculum Committee

notifications.name: Notify Submitter of Receipt
notifications.subject: [HILR CC] Your course proposal has been received.
notifications.message: Dear {sgl_1_name (First):56.3} {sgl_1_name (Last):56.6}, Thank your submitting course proposal {title:1}. The Curriculum Committee chairs will assign a sponsor who will be in touch with you soon. A copy of the proposal is provided below for your reference. —The HILR Curriculum Committee ——————————————— {all_fields}

meta.description: This step enables Admin to set Sponsor and make any necessary changes for review. Admin can set the status field to other than Active to prevent consideration of the proposal.
meta.instructionsValue: {title:1} is a newly submitted proposal. A co-chair must assign a Sponsor to move this proposal on to review by the committee. It is also possible in this step to make edit changes to the proposal, for example correcting obvious errors or moving information to the right place. The proposal will remain in your inbox until a Sponsor is assigned. You must press the Submit button to complete the step.
meta.assignee_notification_subject: [HILR CC] {sgl_1_name (First):56.3}  {sgl_1_name (Last):56.6} has submitted a new course proposal.
meta.in_progress_notification_message: Entry {entry_id} has been updated and remains in progress.
meta.complete_notification_subject: [HILR CC] You have been assigned to sponsor: {title:1} ({sgl_1_name (Last):56.6})
meta.complete_notification_message: Dear {Sponsor:35}, You've been assigned as Sponsor the course proposal entitled {title:1}, submitted by {sgl_1_name (First):56.3} {sgl_1_name (Last):56.6} (proposal #{entry_id}). Follow the link below to your inbox and follow the displayed directions: [HILRCC_inbox_url formid="{form_id}" entryid="{entry_id}"]
meta.confirmation_messageValue:
The Sponsor for the new proposal: "{title:1}" will be {Sponsor:35}.

The proposal will appear in the Sponsor's In Box in CCsubmit until it has been acted upon by the Committee.

meta.description: This step notifies members that a proposal is ready for review. Falls through to Tabling if the status is not Active.
meta.workflow_notification_message: Dear Curriculum Committee Member, Proposal #{entry_id}, {title:1} ({sgl_1_name (Last):56.6}),  is ready for your review. To view this proposal: [HILRCC_proposal_view_url entryid="{entry:id}"] To view the list of all proposals under review:  [HILRCC_proposal_view_url]

meta.description:
This step enables CC Admin to modify proposal prior to final status (reason for tabling). All unpublished proposals go through this step.

NOTE: Due to the conditional execution of the Review Notification step, this step must follow Review Notification in the list of Workflow steps.
meta.instructionsValue: This proposal, {title:1} ({sgl_1_name (Last):56.6}) has been tabled. Pressing Submit will take the proposal out of consideration for this or future terms. This is the normal action for a proposal that has been rejected or withdrawn. Please make a note of the reason for the proposal not receiving further consideration, for the audit trail. Please consult with the system administrator about any other proposals that are at this step—Tabling—that should receive further consideration.
meta.assignee_notification_message:
Placeholder message. A proposal is being tabled. The final status

[HILRCC_inbox_url]
meta.in_progress_notification_message: Entry {entry_id} has been updated and remains in progress.
meta.complete_notification_message:
Dear Sponsor,

The proposal, {title:1} ({sgl_1_name (Last):56.6}), has completed the Curriculum Committee review process. It has a final status of  {pstatus:37}.

If this is not correct, please contact one of the Committee Co-chairs.
meta.confirmation_messageValue: (placeholder confirmation) Thank you. Click here to return to the home page.

meta.description: Send members notification that proposal has changed. Executes conditionally on 'suppress_notifications' field.
meta.workflow_notification_message: Dear HILR Curriculum Committee Member, The proposal {title:1} ({sgl_1_name (Last):56.6}) has had significant changes. Please review it again. Thank you, {user:display_name}

meta.description: At this step, members can comment on the proposal (via View page). The Sponsor (or Admin) can revert to Modification by Sponsor or forward to CC Admins (step Post-review).
meta.instructionsValue:
This proposal is currently Under Review by the Committee. When you decide it's ready for your action, you have three choices:
  • Press Ready to Vote to send the proposal to the Co-Chairs for voting in the next CC meeting.
  • Press Needs Discussion to refer the proposal to the Co-Chairs, for example to bring up the proposal for committee discussion at the next meeting. It is best separately to communicate with the Co-Chairs to explain the situation.
  • Press Edit if you want to make edit changes to the proposal. After editing, you will have choices as to what happens next to the proposal.
If you want to add a Review comment, click Proposals Under Review menu above, and select the proposal.
meta.assignee_notification_message: A new entry is pending your approval. Please check your Workflow Inbox.

meta.description: In this step, the Sponsor modifies fields of the proposal in preparation for committee review, or in response to input from committee members.
meta.instructionsValue:
This proposal is now in the Modification by Sponsor step of the workflow. As the Sponsor, you should make any changes necessary to prepare the proposal for further review by the Committee, or for voting on the proposal. To advance the workflow to the next step, press one of the Submit buttons:  

Submit with notifications to return to Member Review and send email to all CC Members asking for another full review.

Submit without notifications to return to Member Review without sending an email. Be sure to add a Discussion comment explaining what changes you've made. The Member Review process will continue.
meta.assignee_notification_subject: You have been named sponsor of a new course proposal.
meta.assignee_notification_message:
Hello Curriculum Committee Member,

The administrator has named you as sponsor of proposal #{entry_id}, "{title:1}," submitted by {sgl_1_name:8}.

Please follow the link below to your inbox and review the proposal.

[HILRCC_inbox_url]
meta.in_progress_notification_message: Entry {entry_id} has been updated and remains in progress.
meta.confirmation_messageValue: (placeholder confirmation) Thank you for completing the Modification by Sponsor step. Check your Inbox for further tasks.  [HILRCC_inbox_url] Click here to return to the home page.

meta.description: This step enables the CC Admin to route the proposal based on its current disposition.
meta.instructionsValue: After Committee discussion or voting on a proposal, a co-chair must route the proposal. If the proposal was approved, press Approve. The proposal will progress through final editing and time and room assignment to appear in the Course Catalog. If the proposal was rejected, press Reject. The proposal will no longer be considered, and will not be included in the Course Catalog. If the proposal needs additional action by the Sponsor, or further review by the committee, press Send to Sponsor. The proposal will appear in his or her Inbox for further action.
meta.assignee_notification_message: Dear Sponsor, Proposal {title:1} ({sgl_1_name (Last):56.6}), has been returned to you for further review and consideration. It will appear again in your Inbox.
meta.rejection_notification_message: Dear Sponsor, Proposal {title:1} ({sgl_1_name (Last):56.6}), has been rejected by committee vote. It will not be considered further, and will not appear in the Course Catalog. If this action is in error, please contact one of the co-chairs immediately.
meta.approval_notification_message: Dear Sponsor, Proposal {title:1} ({sgl_1_name (Last):56.6}), has been approved by Committee vote. You must make any final changes, as noted in the Committee meeting. The approved proposal will appear in the Course Catalog. If this action is in error, please contact one of the co-chairs immediately. You can access the proposal the URL below: [HILRCC_inbox_url formid=2 entryid={entry_id}]

meta.description: At this step, the CC Admins route the proposal to publication or to the rejection path, based on the decision.
meta.instructionsValue:
Please act on the proposal, based on the Committee vote:
  • Press Approve if the proposal was approved by the Committee. The proposal will move on to publication, for inclusion in the Catalog.
  • Otherwise, press Reject. The proposal will be marked as Rejected, and will not appear in the Catalog.
meta.assignee_notification_message: A new entry is pending your approval. Please check your Workflow Inbox.

meta.description: This step allows the sponsor to make her final edits of a proposal after it has been approved by the committee and before it is routed to the admin for publication.
meta.instructionsValue: The Committee has voted to approve this proposal. Please make any necessary edits, including those that were decided upon in the Committee meeting. Press Submit to confirm the edits and move the proposal to Final Review and publication in the Course Catalog.
meta.assignee_notification_message: Dear {Sponsor:35}, The Committee has voted to approve the  proposal {title:1} ({sgl_1_name (Last):56.6}). Please make any necessary edits, including those that were decided upon in the Committee meeting. Completing the edit step will move the proposal to Final Review and publication in the Course Catalog. You may access the proposal at {workflow_entry_url}.
meta.in_progress_notification_message: Entry {entry_id} has been updated and remains in progress.
meta.complete_notification_message: Entry {entry_id} has been updated completing the step.

meta.description: The Pre-publication step is a User Input step, assigned to the CC Admins. All form fields are editable. The purpose of this step is to enable the CC Admins to make any final edits to form fields prior to starting the Publication step (which is assigned to the Catalog Admin). The Admin will open the form (from the Inbox page), make the necessary changes, and press Submit. This will cause the workflow to start the Publication step.
meta.instructionsValue: In this workflow step, the Co-Chairs have a final opportunity to review the proposal before it is included in the Course Catalog. Note that both Co-Chairs must complete this step to move the proposal to Publication.
meta.assignee_notification_subject: [HILR CC] Proposal is at the pre-publication step
meta.assignee_notification_message: CC Admin: Proposal {title:1} ({sgl_1_name (Last):56.6}) is now at the Pre-publication step. Please visit your inbox: [HILRCC_inbox_url] and select the proposal. Follow the displayed instructions. Note that both Co-Chairs must complete this step by making their final review & edits to move the proposal to Publication.
meta.in_progress_notification_message: Entry {entry_id} has been updated and remains in progress.
meta.complete_notification_message: Entry {entry_id} has been updated completing the step.
meta.confirmation_messageValue: (placeholder confirmation) Thank you. Click here to return to the home page.

meta.description: The Publication step is a User Input step, all fields editable (?), assigned to the Catalog Admin role. The assignee receives an email notification when the workflow starts the step. The purpose of this step is to allow the setting of fields like classroom and course number.
meta.instructionsValue: You may make final changes to this form. [Here explain the difference between Save and Submit buttons.]
meta.assignee_notification_subject: [HILR CC] A proposal has just reached the Publication step
meta.assignee_notification_message: Proposal "{title:1}" is now in the Publication step. Please check your inbox: [HILRCC_inbox_url].
meta.in_progress_notification_message: Entry {entry_id} has been updated and remains in progress.
meta.complete_notification_message: Entry {entry_id} has been updated completing the step.
meta.confirmation_messageValue: (placeholder confirmation) Thank you. Click here to return to the home page.
